translation: Love conquers all
meaning: The ultimate romantic line, making people swoon for millennia - this is one of the best latin sayings.

translation: Let us live, since we must die.
meaning: One of the most powerful Latin quotes.

translation: The die is cast.
meaning: One of the most famous Latin quotes in history.

proverb: Flectere si nequeo superos, Acheronta movebo
translation: If I can not bend the will of Heaven, I shall move Hell.
meaning: When moving Heaven and Earth just isn't enough.

translation: They condemn that which they do not understand.
meaning: A constant failing of humanity, one of the greatest latin sayings.

proverb: Acceptissima semper munera sunt, auctor quae pretiosa facit.
translation: Those gifts are always the most acceptable which our love for the donor makes precious.
meaning: All gifts welcome.

translation: Let them hate so long as they fear.
meaning: Long before Machiavelli, Caligula knew what power was all about.

translation: An empire within an empire.
meaning: When one group really separates from the others.

translation: Fortune favors the bold.
meaning: Repeat every time you go flirt with the hottest girl in the room.

translation: Material wealth is not the one good.
meaning: Makes you feel better for driving that rundown car, right?

proverb: Non fortuna homines aestimabo, sed moribus
translation: I do not estimate the men for their fortune, but for their habits.
meaning: Show your quality in how you behave.

proverb: Pars magna bonitatis est velle fieri bonum
translation: Much of goodness consists in wanting to be good.
meaning: Good news for those of us trying to be good guys.

translation: "here we will stay, most excellently!
meaning: When you've found that perfect table at the bar...

proverb: Homo sum humani a me nihil alienum puto
translation: I am a human being, so nothing human is strange to me.
meaning: We all have that strangeness inside.

translation: The spirit is refreshed with laughter.
meaning: A great line at the beginning of a night with friends.

proverb: Amicus certus in re incerta cernitur
translation: One's friends are known in the hour of need.
meaning: Anyone who's had an "hour of need" knows the truth of such Latin quotes.

translation: Envy is blind.
meaning: It'll sneak up on us for any reason.

translation: I think, therefore I am.
meaning: One of the most famous Latin quotes of all time.

translation: Keep the mind calm.
meaning: Your mantra before a big test or interview.

proverb: Crudelius est quam mori semper timere mortem
translation: It is more cruel to always fear death than to die.
meaning: The YOLO of the ancient world.

proverb: Mea mihi conscientia pluris est quam omnium sermo
translation: My conscience is more to me than what the world says.
meaning: Be who you are, not what people tell you to be.

translation: Trust not too much to looks.
meaning: Wise counsel against being too superficial.

translation: Time flies.
meaning: And you don't even have to be having fun.

translation: Ignorance is the cause of fear.
meaning: Next time someone calls you a nerd, use this to put them in their place.

translation: So many men, so many opinions.
meaning: Particularly when discussing sports or the Game of Thrones finale.

translation: The abundance of food hampers intelligence.
meaning: Said by a man who obviously knew the temptations of a buffet.

translation: Truth never dies.
meaning: ...So pursue truth.

translation: No evil is happy.
meaning: Tell that to those who wrong you.

translation: I came, I saw, I conquered.
meaning: The greatest cry of victory in history.

proverb: Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori
translation: It is sweet and fitting to die for your country.
meaning: Words of comfort for those who put their lives on the line for us.

proverb: Ignis aurum proat, miseria fortes viros
translation: Fire provides proof of gold; misery, proof of strong men.
meaning: We all go through it, but can you withstand it?

translation: Hard work conquers all.
meaning: At least, that's what your parents have always told you.

translation: He who wants everything loses everything
meaning: The power of making choices about what you want in life.

translation: Live remembering death.
meaning: Morbid, but the key to a life well lived.

proverb: Quam bene vivas refert, non quam diu
translation: It is how well you live that matters, not how long.
meaning: Another of our YOLO Latin quotes out of the classical age.

proverb: Noli foras ire, in teipsum reddi; in interiore homine habitat veritas
translation: Don't lose yourself, return to you, inside of you lives the truth.
meaning: Words of strength for those who struggle to be themselves.

translation: If you wish to be loved, love.
meaning: Great advice for those afraid to put themselves out there.

translation: The clothes make the man.
meaning: ...So dress well.

proverb: Amor animi arbitrio sumitur, non ponitur
translation: We choose to love, we do not choose to cease loving.
meaning: The ultimate, sad truth of millions of breakups.

proverb: Cui amat periculum in illo peribit
translation: Whoever loves danger will perish by it.
meaning: Put that on your dashboard so you don't speed.

translation: I love and hate
meaning: Don't we all, Catullus?

translation: Save me and I'll save you.
meaning: The power of extending favors to others.

translation: I will find the way, or I will make one.
meaning: Repeat that any time someone says you can't do something.

translation: No mortal is wise at all times.
meaning: A reminder of the limits of your wisdom.

proverb: Fortis est non pertubaris in rebus asperis
translation: The strong do not falter in adversity.
meaning: Show strength by keeping to the right path.

proverb: Omne quod movetur ab alio movetur
translation: Everything that moves is moved by something else.
meaning: None of us are independent of our society and everyone in it.

proverb: Amicitiae nostrae memoriam spero sempiternam fore
translation: I hope that memory of our friendship will be everlasting.
meaning: What a line to deliver to a close friend!

translation: Many fear their reputation, few their conscience.
meaning: Too many worry about what others think first.

proverb: Optimum est pati quod emendare non possis.
translation: It is best to endure what you cannot change.
meaning: Words to get through those tough times that none of us can avoid.

proverb: Leve fit, quod bene fertur, onus
translation: The load is lite, if you know how to support it.
meaning: Life only seems tough because you've got the wrong perspective.

translation: Divide and conquered.
meaning: Advice for when life feels too full of big problems.

translation: Fate leads the willing, and drags the unwilling.
meaning: You're going there anyway, so enjoy the ride!

translation: Old habits die hard.
meaning: ...So be careful what habits you make.

proverb: Fere libenter homines, id quod volunt, credunt.
translation: People almost always willingly believe what you want.
meaning: The power of persuasion.

translation: To rule yourself is the ultimate power.
meaning: Tape that on every willpower-defying sweet in the house.

proverb: Perfer et obdura; dolor hic tibi proderit olim
translation: Be patient and tough, this pain will serve you one day.
meaning: Broken-hearted, unemployed, or struggling, remember that it's making you tougher.

translation: All art is but an imitation of nature.
meaning: A necessary reminder when we get too invested in our favorite shows.

proverb: Exigo a me non ut optimis par sim sed ut malis melior
translation: I require myself not to be equal to the best, but to be better than the bad.
meaning: Set the right standards so you can meet them.

translation: A sound mind in a sound body.
meaning: The ideal we should all aspire to.

proverb: Ab alio expectes alteri quod feceris
translation: Expect to receive such treatment as you have given.
meaning: The Golden Rule in another form.

proverb: Aequam memento rebus in arduis servare mentem
translation: In adversity, remember to keep an even mind.
meaning: Latin quotes love a man who keeps his head.

proverb: Sedit qui timuit ne non succederet
translation: He who feared that he would not succeed sat still.
meaning: Get out there and try. It's the only way you'll ever succeed.

proverb: Forsan et haec olim meminisse iuvabit
translation: Perhaps, one day, remembering even these things will bring pleasure.
meaning: Consolation in the hard times.

proverb: Perfer et obdura, dolor hic tibi proderit olim
translation: Be strong and endure, someday this pain will be useful to you.
meaning: Live through it, and you'll be stronger.

translation: War is sweet to the inexperienced.
meaning: Putting those calling for wars in their place.

proverb: Multo autem ad rem magis pertinet quallis tibi vide aris quam allis
translation: It is much more important what you think of yourself, than what others think of you.
meaning: Powerful advice for your self-esteem from two millennia ago.

proverb: Oportet esse ut vivas, non vivere ut edas
translation: Should eat to live, not live to eat.
meaning: So put down that extra piece of pizza.

translation: Now we drink.
meaning: To be shouted out as you enter the bar.

translation: Dare to be wise
meaning: Nerd motivation.

translation: No one is born without faults.
meaning: ...including you.

translation: The words can not return.
meaning: What you say when you can't unsend an email.

proverb: Aegroto dum anima est, spes esse dicitur
translation: As long as there is life there is hope for the ill one, it is said.
meaning: Anyone who has known a sick loved one, knows this.

proverb: Saepe ne utile quidem est scire quid futurum sit
translation: Often it is not even advantageous to know what will be
meaning: So stop trying to guess the future and live now.

translation: Where there is unity, there is the victory.
meaning: Stick together when it gets tough.

translation: The appearances of things are deceptive.
meaning: Don't trust that everything is always as it seems.

translation: And you, Brutus?" last words of Caesar after being murdered by his friend; used today to convey utter betrayal
meaning: Still the most popular of Latin quotes about betrayal.

proverb: Quam se ipse amans, sine rivale
translation: By loving yourself, with no rival.
meaning: Your greatest strength is your self-belief.

translation: The beasts flee the dangers they see.
meaning: Be at least as smart as the beasts.

translation: Woe to the conquered.
meaning: Said before a major dodge ball game.

proverb: Homo vitae commodatus non donatus est
translation: Man's life is lent, not given
meaning: None of us are entitled to another day, so use your time well.

translation: Empty pots make the most noise.
meaning: An epic putdown of fools in any era.

proverb: Historia magistra vitae et testis temporum
translation: History is the teacher and witness of times
meaning: A reminder to crack a history book sometimes.

translation: The result justifies the deed.
meaning: Ends justify the means.

translation: Through adversity to the stars
meaning: Stay tough and reach your dreams.

translation: Knowledge itself is power
meaning: So learn for its own sake.

translation: Every man is the artisan of his own fortune.
meaning: ...So craft the life you want to live.

translation: I am not led; I lead.
meaning: Forge your own path forward.

proverb: pecunia, si uti scis, ancilla est; si nescis, domina
translation: If you know how to use money, money is your slave; if you don't, money is your master
meaning: Put that in your wallet, so you think about all those impulse purchases before you make them.

translation: In the absence of light, darkness prevails.
meaning: So, be the light.

proverb: Dum inter homines sumus, colamus humanitatem.
translation: As long as we are among humans, let us be humane.
meaning: There is always reason to be kind.

proverb: Disce quasi semper victurus vive quasi cras moriturus
translation: Learn as if you're always going to live; live as if tomorrow you're going to die
meaning: So study...and go out and party!

proverb: Ad turpia virum bonum nulla spes invitat.
translation: No expectation can allure a good man to the commission of evil.
meaning: Good men stay clear of evil, always.

proverb: Nullum magnum ingenium sine mixture dementia fuit.
translation: There has been no great wisdom without an element of madness.
meaning: So let your freak flag fly! You're a genius!

proverb: Ut avertam oculos meos ad intendum
translation: I close my eyes in order to see
meaning: Real truth comes from a place deeper than basic observation.

translation: That man is wise who talks little
meaning: Better to be quiet and thoughtful than loud and foolish.

translation: Examine the past, examine the present, examine the future
meaning: There's wisdom in all three directions.

translation: Who is silent gives consent
meaning: So speak up if you don't like something!

translation: Flatterers are the worst type of enemies
meaning: Suspicions of lavish compliments can be wise.

translation: Small things occupy light minds
meaning: Tell that to those who are always crying over spilt milk.

translation: It is fitting that a liar should be a man of good memory
meaning: Shout that when someone brings up some event from way in the past.

translation: A voice and nothing more.
meaning: Say it to those who are always talking and talking badly about others.

translation: Knowledge through hard work
meaning: You worked hard to get this nerdy!

proverb: Vino vendibili hedera non opus est
translation: A popular wine needs no ivy.
meaning: If you've got what people want, you don't have to dress it up.

translation: The truth will make you free.
meaning: Try this out next time someone you now is lying to you.

translation: Spoken words fly away, written words remain.
meaning: It should be written above every English teacher's chalk board.

translation: is literally said to be "wise as far as his beard"
meaning: Sure, he looks clever, but it's really all in the beard.

translation: "a beard does not make a philosopher,"
meaning: Maybe spend more time reading books than grooming the 'stache.

translation: meaning "the beard grows, but the head doesn’t grow wiser.
meaning: Latin quotes clearly have issues with fools with beards.

translation: meaning "a crow will not pull out the eye of another crow.
meaning: When they're like, they don't fight.

translation: Experience teaches.
meaning: It isn't always pleasant, but we learn from the tough stuff.

translation: Prosperity has many friends.
meaning: Amazing how many people love you when you've got a bit of cash.

translation: Good clothes make a stupid man look noble.
meaning: The power of a good shirt.

translation: How desirable is wisdom or knowledge.
meaning: A rare sentiment these days, but one very much worthy of repeating.

proverb: Saepe malum petitur, saepe bonum fugitur
translation: Evil is often sought, good is often shunned.
meaning: The sad state of humanity.

translation: With truth preserved.
meaning: Words to cling to when you're right and no one believes you.

proverb: Sapiens nihil affirmat quod non probat
translation: A wise man states as true nothing he does not prove - do not swear to anything you do not know firsthand
meaning: Great advice to stay quiet when you don't know the answer.

translation: To each his own.
meaning: You already know the expression, now look clever using it in Latin.

translation: We are what we are
meaning: Said by the Roman Popeye.

translation: Dead men do not sue.
meaning: Probably the slogan of the Roman mafia.

translation: By teaching, we learn
meaning: Tell that to a teacher you love.

translation: Mindful of what has been done, aware of what will be
meaning: Always live in the past, present, and future.

proverb: Aut tace aut loquere meliora silentio
translation: Be quiet or say something better than silence
meaning: Don't just talk to hear your voice.

proverb: Omnes volumnus plus. Et plus, et plus et plurimus
translation: We all want more. And more, and more and much more.
meaning: Muttered on the way to our fifth plate at the buffet.

proverb: Posside sapientiam, quia auro melior est
translation: Possessing wisdom is better than owning gold
meaning: For all the poor book-lovers out there.

proverb: An dives sit omnes quærunt, nemo an bonus
translation: Every one inquires if he is rich; no one asks if he is good.
meaning: A reminder how often we think of our pocket books instead of our souls.

proverb: A solis ortu usque ad occasum
translation: From where the sun rises to where it sets.
meaning: A mic drop response to "Did you have a long day?"

proverb: Difficilius est sarcire concordiam quam rumpere
translation: It is more difficult to restore harmony than sow dissension.
meaning: It's easier to break it than to fix it.

translation: Though the wound is healed, a scar remains.
meaning: When we hurt people, it never wholly goes away.

translation: It is human to err.
meaning: None of us are perfect.

proverb: Laudari a viro laudato maxima est laus
translation: To be commended by a man of high repute is the greatest possible praise.
meaning: It's why we're so eager for our heroes to like us.

translation: And knowledge itself, is power
meaning: It's still the secret to rising in the world.

proverb: Non qui parum habet, sed qui plus cupit, pauper est
translation: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
meaning: Having a lot can be it's own curse.

proverb: Malum sed mulliere, sed necessarium malum
translation: Women are evil, a necessary evil
meaning: Spoken by ancient men complaining of girlfriends.

translation: Many acquaintances, no friends
meaning: A sign of a lonely life.

translation: Crowded with men, yet bare of friends.
meaning: Likely an unfriendly place to be.

translation: A thing desired, but regretfully wanting
meaning: What you call that game you are saving up to buy.

translation: War feeds itself.
meaning: Which is why it is always happening.

proverb: Eram quod es, eris quod sum
translation: I was what you are, you will be what I am
meaning: A powerful reminder of our mortality.

translation: No need of words, trust deeds.
meaning: Don't believe promises, believe people who deliver.

proverb: De hoc multi multa, omnes aliquid, nemo satis
translation: Of this many have said many things, all something, no one enough.
meaning: About those important issues people don't focus enough on.

translation: As is the father, so is the son;
meaning: A reminder for all the new fathers out there.

proverb: Viris fortibus non opus est moenibus
translation: To brave men, walls are unnecessary.
meaning: ..because you'll break them down.

proverb: Accensa domo proximi, tua quoque periclitatur.
translation: When the house of your neighbour is in flames, your own is in danger.
meaning: We're all in this together.

translation: Art is long, life is short.
meaning: So dedicate time to making your immortal art.

translation: sweeter after difficulties
meaning: For the nice guys who have been through a lot.

translation: One night awaits everyone.
meaning: We all head the same direction in the end.

translation: Never despair!
meaning: ...Even in the tough times.

translation: Manhood rouses one's strength.
meaning: For anyone depressed on their 18th birthday.

translation: We can’t all of us do everything.
meaning: Wise words about marking tough choices about what we want to do.

translation: Leave all else to the gods.
meaning: Advice to stop worrying so much about what you can't control.

translation: The more common an evil is, the worse it is.
meaning: ...and we're all guilty of a few of those evils.

translation: Through difficulties to honors
meaning: Words to inspire getting over setbacks.

translation: Through fire, nature is reborn whole.
meaning: Sometimes, it's all got to burn away.

translation: They condemn what they do not understand.
meaning: It's why you used to get teased.

translation: To err is human, to persist in it, is diabolial.
meaning: Time to learn from your mistakes.

translation: Never unprepared; always ready.
meaning: As we all should be.

proverb: Sine labore non erit panis in ore
translation: Without work there will not be any bread in your mouth.
meaning: Latin quotes have no time for lazy people.

translation: Nothing stands in the way
meaning: Not if you're really determined to get somewhere.

translation: To not go forward is to go backward
meaning: Never feel like you've come "far enough."

translation: I am not such as I was; "I am not the kind of person I once was"
meaning: Signs of growth from experience.

translation: It is tossed by the waves but it does not sink
meaning: A tough ship, or a tough man.

translation: Either to conquer or die.
meaning: For moments when there can be no compromise.

translation: Learn or leave.
meaning: The lesson of life.

translation: Learn to endure.
meaning: A lesson best learned early.

translation: Works are harder than words
meaning: For those who are always failing to deliver on their promises.

proverb: Legum servi sumus ut liberi esse possimus
translation: We are slaves of the laws in order that we may be free.
meaning: Throw this out there next time someone asks why we even need laws.

proverb: Per me quod eritque fuitque estque patet.
translation: That which is and was and will be lies open through me.
meaning: We are the only conduits of time.

translation: I am willing but unable.
meaning: Your answer when asked to a party you can't attend.

translation: Always towards better things
meaning: Your true north direction in life.

translation: bold but faithful
meaning: How you want your friends to see you.

translation: I struggle and emerge
meaning: ...no matter what you throw at me.

translation: Reach for the heights
meaning: No point in settling for less.

translation: This is war
meaning: Use that after someone insults you.

translation: I will die unvanquished
meaning: A great gamer quote.

proverb: Sic ego nec sine te nec tecum vivere possum
translation: So I can’t live either without you or with you.
meaning: Latin quotes know how breakups work.

proverb: Unus pro omnibus, omnes pro uno
translation: One for all, all for one.
meaning: A classic line, now new (in an old language).

translation: Death is the ultimate limit.
meaning: And the only one we should recognize.

translation: It is my lot today, yours tomorrow
meaning: For those who think they are immune to tough times.

translation: Always faithful
meaning: Whisper that to your girlfriend.

translation: Always the same.
meaning: Say it with a yawn at the start of a boring class.

translation: Even in Arcadia, here I am.
meaning: Words to send off loved ones.

translation: She flies with her own wings
meaning: How you describe the independent women you admire.

translation: Then we will fight in the shade.
meaning: A line even cooler in Latin.

proverb: Vir prudens non contra ventum mingit.
translation: A wise man does not pee against the wind.
meaning: Somehow crass, poetic, and true.

translation: There is truth in wine
meaning: Adoring bar walls for thousands of years.

translation: Each man is the maker of his own fortune.
meaning: It's in your hands, man.

translation: What has been wrongly gained is wrongly lost.
meaning: When someone steals your stuff.

translation: The useful with the agreeable
meaning: The ideal type of friend.

translation: The play is over, applaud!
meaning: Throw that out at an audience that forgets to respond.

proverb: Quis, Quid, Ubi, Quibus Auxiliis, Cur, Quomodo, Quando?
translation: Who, what, where, with what, why, how, when?
meaning: For those who forget all the details to their stories.

translation: Let the buyer beware
meaning: Latin quotes prove Romans knew all about scammy products.

translation: It is impossible for a deed to be undone.
meaning: When you're asked if you'll complete the project.

translation: A wolf is not afraid of a barking dog.
meaning: How you respond to those trying to intimidate you.

translation: All other things being equal.
meaning: Just add that into your debate script somewhere.

proverb: Amore et melle et felle es fecundissimus.
translation: Love is rich with honey and venom.
meaning: Love's dual nature in one line.

translation: What are we, babies?
meaning: A classic taunt, now in Latin!

translation: An absolutely necessary component or ingredient.
meaning: The friend who glues the group together.

translation: Let there be light.
meaning: In Latin, a fancy way to turn on the lights.

translation: Get off my back, Satan.
meaning: So much cooler in Latin.

translation: Seize the wine
meaning: The correct response to carpe diem.

translation: Hannibal is at the gates.
meaning: When stuff really hits the fan.

translation: Danger is sweet.
meaning: Looks sweet scrawled across your motorcycle.

translation: My apology; my error
meaning: The classy way to apologize.

translation: On toward infinity.
meaning: From Rome's Buzz Lightyear.

translation: By this act (or fact).
meaning: Throwing down the fancy language gauntlet when debating.

translation: In secret.
meaning: That's right, "camera" meant "secret. Boy we mixed that up.

translation: Nothing more beyond
meaning: Response to "do you have anything else to say?"

translation: There can be only one.
meaning: How you argue over the last free ticket available.

translation: an empty threat
meaning: Mumble that the next time someone threatens you to act tough.

translation: Under the rose. Means "private or secret".
meaning: Invite a girl for a meeting "sub rosa."

translation: No day is long for the busy
meaning: Stay busy and avoid boredom.

translation: who benefits?
meaning: Asked when looking for motive in ancient crimes.

translation: The voice of nothing
meaning: A dismissal fo fools for the ages.

translation: To the end; at or near the end.
meaning: Answer to, "how long will you be binging this show?"

translation: Love of money. phrase
meaning: Call someone greedy in a way they won't understand.

translation: Secret of secrets.
meaning: For those secrets you really don't want shared.

translation: The art of loving.
meaning: The subject you'll study your whole life.

translation: God willing.
meaning: Repackage a cliched phrase in new language.

translation: Have a nice day.
meaning: Test that out when leaving work next time.

translation: I have spoken.
meaning: End conversations like a Roman emperor.

translation: Now and forever
meaning: The only kind of promise that matters.

translation: Here lies.
meaning: Posted above your bed.

translation: Read 'em and weep.
meaning: Bet you didn't know that line was so old.

translation: I am the master of the universe!
meaning: Another masterful taunt from the ancient world.

translation: Nothing above that!
meaning: Written on the edges of the world by Hercules.

translation: A new man
meaning: Show the changed man you've become in the old way.

translation: happy mistake
meaning: A far cooler way to use that phrase than the English.

translation: At the same time both said and done.
meaning: Proving you're a man of deeds to others.

translation: Unknown period of time.
meaning: Your answer when your parents want to know when the chores will be done.

translation: For the public good
meaning: Still a popular legal term today.

translation: Blank slate
meaning: The Romans knew how to let people start over too.

translation: Yes and no
meaning: Latin quotes for the non-committal.

translation: From the bottom of the chest - from the bottom of the heart
meaning: Showing earnestness in the old tongue.

translation: From within.
meaning: Where all our truth is found.

translation: Let it all hang out.
meaning: An invitation to complete honesty.

translation: Get a life.
meaning: Tell people off without them ever knowing.

translation: For honor
meaning: An old fashioned idea in an old fashioned language.

translation: Love of one's country : patriotism
meaning: Romans were some of the most patriotic people in history.

translation: What is said is done
meaning: ...So mind your words.

translation: From the heart -- "sincerely"
meaning: Sign off your letters with that.

translation: Always brave
meaning: Your new dog's name.

translation: Act in a manly way
meaning: Say that before you leave the house every day.

translation: In existence
meaning: Your answer to "where's so-and-so?"

translation: Either drink or go.
meaning: For those who try to end the party early.

translation: Without preparation.
meaning: How you tend to show up for tests.

translation: Beneath one's dignity.
meaning: Another thing to say when your parents ask you to do chores.

translation: Be it unsaid.
meaning: When it's better to just drop the conversation.

translation: It does not follow
meaning: And why don't we ride zebras like horses?

translation: Out of many, one
meaning: It's on the back of U.S. currency.

translation: The last resort
meaning: When all other options are exhausted.

translation: Faster, higher, stronger
meaning: Spoken by Rome's Kanye West.

translation: Live today.
meaning: Advice for every day, from then to now.

translation: As time goes by.
meaning: Or, "as the years roll on."

translation: Love and honor
meaning: Two key markers in your life.

translation: To the stars
meaning: A great title for your sci-fi book.

translation: Now or never
meaning: One of the Latin quotes building courage for centuries.

translation: Overcome evil with good
meaning: Wise advice when we've been wronged.

translation: A man of all times
meaning: Your new nickname.

translation: Love
meaning: What it's all about.

translation: Strength
meaning: Of mind or body.

translation: Power
meaning: The great corruptor.

translation: Warrior
meaning: The noble profession from ancient times.

translation: Life
meaning: Your most precious resource.

translation: Wisdom
meaning: The most desired quality in the ancient world.

translation: Freedom
meaning: What we all desire.

translation: By virtue and arms or "by manhood and weapons"
meaning: Virtue first, but there's always the tools of last resort.

translation: I believe because it is absurd.
meaning: The foundation of faith.

translation: Dedicate your life to truth.
meaning: There's no higher calling.

translation: An eagle does not catch [does not bother with] flies.
meaning: As easy way to dismiss pesky criticism or complaints.

translation: Bread and circuses.
meaning: Ancient words about bad leadership.

translation: The Emperor is not above the grammarians.
meaning: Which is why we get to laugh when a leader looks foolish.

translation: Quit ye like men, be strong
meaning: For those moments you're struggling with your courage.

translation: I learn by teaching, think by writing.
meaning: So engage in both activities.

translation: The more numerous the laws, the more corrupt the state.
meaning: A case for a few, simple rules.

translation: To endure is harder to attack
meaning: So attack!

translation: Love is the essence of life
meaning: There would be no life if there were no love. Just as love is necessary to give birth to new life, love is necessary for people to live, too. This motto teaches us that love is essential for living - without it, what life is there to live?

translation: The beginnings of all things are small.
meaning: So don't feel bad starting small.

proverb: Fere libenter homines id quod volunt credunt.
translation: Men generally believe what they want to.
meaning: You can only do so much to convince people.

translation: To do is to dare
meaning: In praise of being bold.

translation: He conquers who, conquers himself.
meaning: You're the one holding you back.

translation: I am not led, I lead.
meaning: Stop being a follower.

proverb: Aut cum scuto aut in scuto
translation: Either with shield or on shield.
meaning: A classic fight or die fighting Latin quote.

translation: Always prepared
meaning: That's half the battle.

translation: Actions, not words.
meaning: Speak less, do more.

translation: Prepared in minds and resources (ready for anything).
meaning: Whatever comes at you, you can handle it.

translation: Master of himself.
meaning: ...So you can master anything.

translation: The wolf changes his coat, not his disposition.
meaning: Words of warning when some people claim they changed.

translation: Know thyself.
meaning: Where knowledge starts.

translation: Either kill or be killed
meaning: Words to post on your Xbox One.

translation: Leadership by example
meaning: Latin quotes are all about proving yourself in your actions.

translation: Humility conquers pride
meaning: It seems weaker, but it's the stronger emotion.

proverb: Praesis ut prosis ne ut imperes
translation: Lead in order to serve, not in order to rule
meaning: A reminder why you want to lead.

translation: If you want peace, prepare for war
meaning: A sad necessity in life.

translation: To live is to conquer
meaning: It's how we move forward.

translation: To live is to fight
meaning: If you aren't fighting, you're giving up.

translation: Take charge
meaning: Or, "take your responsibilities."

proverb: Ego amissus pugna sed autere bellum
translation: I lost the battle but I won the war
meaning: A setback doesn't have to be the end.

translation: Yield to no one
meaning: Prove your stuff against all comers.

translation: The language of truth is simple.
meaning: So stop complicating it and speak straight.

translation: Mortal actions never deceive the gods.
meaning: You aren't fooling anyone.

translation: Carthage must be destroyed.
meaning: When Rome said it, they meant business.

translation: From nothing comes nothing
meaning: If you don't try, nothing happens.

translation: Holding a wolf by the ears.
meaning: ...probably not a good idea.

translation: Laughing corrects morals.
meaning: The power of comedy.

translation: The stars incline us, they do not bind us.
meaning: We are the masters of our fate.

translation: A great fortune is a great slavery.
meaning: Maybe you don't want to make it rich.

translation: Who will guard the guards?
meaning: The risks of giving anyone too much power.

proverb: Absentem laedit cum ebrio qui litigat
translation: To quarrel with a drunk is to wrong a man who is not even there.
meaning: Keep that in mind when your roommate comes home at 3 am next time.

translation: Nobody's perfect.
meaning: Including you...and everyone who fails you.

translation: We gladly feast on those who would subdue us.
meaning: No mercy on your enemies!

translation: My hovercraft is full of eels.
Let ill will be absent.
meaning: Great advice when making up after an argument.

translation: Nature is not saddened.
meaning: It is, unfortunately, indifferent.

translation: My hovercraft is full of eels.
meaning: ...probably not of ancient origin.

translation: Seller beware.
meaning: The twin to the more famous phrase.

translation: Friends are tested in adversity.
meaning: That's when you know they're real friends.

proverb: Cave quid dicis, quando, et cui
translation: Beware what you say, when, and to whom.
meaning: Always watch your words.

translation: While we live, let us really live.
meaning: We only have so much time, so enjoy it.

translation: No one gives what he does not have.
meaning: So don't expect more than people can give.

proverb: Non omne quod nitet aurum est
translation: Not everything that is shining is gold.
meaning: Don't trust appearances.

translation: Where you feel good, there is your home.
meaning: Home is where you want to be.

translation: No one is obligated beyond what he is able to do.
meaning: Don't feel you are responsible beyond your limits.

translation: Truth conquers all things.
meaning: So seek truth.

translation: Remember that you are alive
meaning: You aren't a robot, no matter how your job makes you feel.

translation: While I breathe, I hope
meaning: There's still time to change things.

translation: A man without love cannot live
meaning: It's why we must always seek love.

proverb: Amicitia quae desinere potest, vera nunquam fuit
translation: A friendship that can cease, was never a true friendship
meaning: Words of comfort to those who have lost friends.

proverb: Annorum vinum, socius vetus et vetus aurum
translation: Old wine, old friend and old gold
meaning: Latin quotes know a thing about the value of old things.

proverb: Veram amicitiam in adversa fortuna videbamus
translation: We'll see true friendship in times of bad luck
meaning: When the going gets tough, you know who is with you.

proverb: Audi, vide, tace, si vis vivere in pace
translation: Use your ears and eyes, but hold your tongue, if you would live in peace.
meaning: Don't say foolish things in the heat of the moment.

proverb: Abbati, medico, patrono que intima pande
translation: Conceal not the truth from thy physician and lawyer.
meaning: Only a fool lies to either.

translation: A noble heart is an immovable heart.
meaning: So we aspire to that nobility.

proverb: Fit scelus indulgens per nubila sæcula virtus
translation: In times of trouble leniency becomes crime.
meaning: Sometimes, we've got to be tough.

translation: Believe that you have it, and you do.
meaning: The ancient "fake it to make it."

translation: Gifts of enemies are no gifts.
meaning: Don't trust every compliment.

translation: All that is fair must fade
meaning: Beauty is temporary, so look for what is permanent.

translation: If you are unsure what it is best to do, do nothing at all.
meaning: Sometimes, it's best not to act.

proverb: Latet enim veritas, sed nihil pretiosius veritate
translation: Truth is hidden, but nothing is more beautiful than the truth.
meaning: Even when you can't see it, seek it.

translation: Ignorance is not an excuse
meaning: Throw that out next time someone says, "But I didn't know!"

translation: The brave may fall, but cannot yield.
meaning: You prove your bravery in your resilience.

translation: Take it for what is worth.
meaning: Keep an open mind about it.

translation: Once you have accomplished little things, you can attempt great things
meaning: Start with baby steps before you take big leaps.

proverb: Omnia mutantur nos et mutamur in illis
translation: All things change, and we change with them.
meaning: We're just a part of nature.

translation: Everything happens for a reason.
meaning: The classy way to deliver this consolation.

translation: From possibility to actuality
meaning: Move from dreaming it to realizing it.

translation: Old age should rather be feared than death
meaning: The ancient "better to burn out than fade away."

translation: Let your light shine
meaning: Power advice in any language.

proverb: Accipe quod tuum, alterique da suum.
translation: Take what is yours, leave theirs to them
meaning: Avoid overreach.

translation: Life is easier with a smile
meaning: So why not just be happy?

translation: Time is the devourer of things.
meaning: Tough but true words.

translation: Words move people, examples draw/compel them.
meaning: So explain with examples.

translation: Truth prevails.
meaning: Shout this when you finally win an argument.

translation: A fox may change its hair, not its tricks.
meaning: If they wronged you before, don't listen when they say they've changed.

translation: Silence is golden
meaning: We really underrate quiet.

translation: Rest with dignity.
meaning: Fine words to send off those we love.
